s0152: Over a month, the Son of Heaven because closest, thus commanded officials saying: 'King Xian of Changshan died young, queen and consorts not harmonious, legitimate and illegitimate falsely contended, fell into unrighteousness and extinguished kingdom, I greatly pity it.
s0153: Enfeoff King Xian's son Ping with 30,000 households, as King of Zhending;
s0154: enfeoff son Shang with 30,000 households, as King of Sishui.'
s0156: King Ping of Zhending, in Yuanding year 4 was made King of Zhending using King Xian of Changshan's son.
s0157: King Si of Sishui, Shang, in Yuanding year 4 was made King of Sishui using King Xian of Changshan's son.
s0158: Eleven years died, his son King Ai Anshi succeeded.
s0160: Thus the emperor pitied Sishui king extinguished, then established Anshi's younger brother He as King of Sishui.
s0161: The above four kingdoms—the original kings were all Lady Wang née Xu's sons.
s0162: Afterwards Han moreover enfeoffed their branch sons as King of Liu'an and King of Sishui two kingdoms.
s0163: Altogether Xu's descendants, to now are six kings.
s0164: The Grand Historian says: In Gaozu's time feudal lords all contributed taxes, could appoint their own interior minister and below, Han alone appointed chancellor for them, golden seal.
s0165: Feudal lords appointed their own censor, Chamberlain for Law Enforcement chief, erudite, comparable to the Son of Heaven.
s0166: After Wu and Chu rebellion, five clans kings generation after generation, Han appointed two thousand shi officials for them, removed 'chancellor' called 'prime minister', silver seal.
s0167: Feudal lords only obtained to eat taxes, stripped their power.
s0168: Afterwards poor feudal lords sometimes rode ox carts.
